english: military campaign; operation; major battle; campaign-level battle

etymology.description: 战(戰 ‘war/battle’) + 役 (‘campaign/service’) = campaign-level military operation/major battle.
etymology.interpretation: Denotes a campaign-level military operation, often comprising multiple battles coordinated to achieve an operational objective. Contrasts with 战斗 (single engagement) and sits below 战争 (war) in scale.
etymology.simplification: 戰→战 was simplified to reduce strokes and standardize components; 役 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 这场战役改变了战争的走向(這場戰役改變了戰爭的走向)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè chǎng zhànyì gǎibiàn le zhànzhēng de zǒuxiàng.
examples.english: This campaign changed the course of the war.

examples.chinese: 司令部制定了这次战役的总体计划(司令部制定了這次戰役的總體計劃)。
examples.pinyin: Sīlìngbù zhìdìng le zhè cì zhànyì de zǒngtǐ jìhuà.
examples.english: The headquarters formulated the overall plan for this campaign.

examples.chinese: 与上一次战役相比，这次投入的兵力更大(與上一次戰役相比，這次投入的兵力更大)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ shàng yī cì zhànyì xiāngbǐ, zhè cì tóurù de bīnglì gèng dà.
examples.english: Compared with the previous campaign, more troops were committed this time.
